title: [Self-Directed] Science Website Motivation Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Basic website navigation skills and understanding of primary/secondary science concepts
context.additional_context: Strengthening smartphone-based learning activities with parallel offline group workshops

learning_goals: Learners can identify five core elements (color, layout, interaction) in website design that influence motivation.
Learners can analyze the motivational level of target websites using an evaluation checklist based on the ARCS model (Attention, Relevance, Confidence, Satisfaction).
Learners can visualize experimental results comparing two different science website designs as graphs by applying repeated measures.

resources: Large-Scale Evaluation Board for Offline Workshops
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
